ab.title: Genesis 20
ab.l: And Abraham journeyed from there toward the landof the south and dwelt between Kadeshand Shur and lived in Gerar.
AndAbraham said of Sarah his wife, ‘She is my sister.’ And Abimelech,king of Gerar, sent and took Sarah.
Andan angel came to Abimelech through a dream of the night, and saidto him, ‘Lo, you will die because of that woman that you have taken, forshe is wedded to a man.’
But Abimelech had not approachedher, and he said, ‘Oh Lord, will you kill a righteous kingdom as well?
Lo, that man said to me, “She is my sister.”And the woman — she, too — said, “He is my brother.” I did this in the integrityof my heart and in the cleanness of my palms.’

And God said to him through the dream, ‘I know, too,that you did this in the integrity of your heart. Because of thatI have kept you, too, from being sinful against me. ThereforeI did not let you touch her.
Now, returnthe man’s wife, because he is a prophet, and he shall pray for you,and you will live. But if you do not return her, know that you will surely die,you and all who are yours.’
SoAbimelech rose up early at dawn and called all his servantsand told them all these things in their ears.And the men were very much afraid.

And Abimelech called Abraham, and said to him, ‘What have you doneto us? And how did I sin against you, that you have almost brought a great sin onme and on my kingdom? You have done thingswith me that are not done.’
And Abimelech saidto Abraham, ‘What did you see, that you did this thing?’
And Abraham said, ‘Because I said, “Yet there is nofear of God at all in this place, and they will kill mebecause of my wife.”
And also she is, indeed, my sister,she is the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother, and she becamea wife to me.

And it was, when God orderedme to go from my father’s house, that I said to her,“This shall be the kindness which you shall do with me: to every place wherewe come, say about me, “He is my brother.””’
And Abimelech took sheep, and cattle, and servants, and maidservants, and gave them to Abraham,and returned Sarah, his wife, to him.
AndAbimelech said to Abraham, ‘Lo, my land is before you.Dwell at the place that would seem good in your eyes.’

And to Sarah he said, ‘Lo, I have given your brother a thousand pieces of silver.Lo, it is a covering of eyes for you, for all that are with you.’ seg type="commented" n="#seg007"/Andafter hearing all of this, Sarah was reproved for sayingabout her husband, ‘He is my brother.’anchor type="commented" xml:id="seg007"/
SoAbraham prayed to God, and God healedAbimelech, and his wife and his maidservants, andthey bore.
Because the Lord had surely closed everywomb of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah,Abraham’s wife.
